oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Winning strategies against Hemonchus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jones Cook, Meredyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hemonchus
sheep
goat
parasites
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hemonchus contortus is the most serious parasite facing small ruminant herds and flocks. Anthelmintic resistance and gastro­intestinal parasitism due to this parasite have been identified as the greatest threats to small ruminant production worldwide (Waller 1997). Critical management areas for control of Hemon­chus include refugia, environment, nutrition, genetics and drugs.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2023 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 94-97
